@mcmillen @ncweaver crypto needs more informed / better skeptics. only reason i engage on stuff like this
@ncweaver for anyone wondering - this will not burn the rainforest it is on pos chain with relatively small/efficient validator set
@mcmillen @ncweaver you have my address, feel free to send me one :D (might i suggest https://t.co/Zd8dUK94d2)
crypto payments and financial services can benefit underserved groups precisely because they are irreversible and function similarly to cash

banks face asymmetric downside risk from serving many low income/low asset clients due to these charge back risks

lack of access pushes people to predatory non-bank financial services like check cashing stores and high cost prepaid debit cards

reg E allows for reversal of unauthorized payments that are reported within 60 days of receiving statement (basically up to 90 days chargeback period)

so banks are extending credit and taking risk exposure for any electronic payment

newsflash for the bleeding heart liberals who think crypto can never work because there's no way to reverse fraud or theft

reg E and other electronic payment "consumer protection" measures are the primary driver of underbanking in the US

how is this? https://t.co/qx4f22tgPd

@ncweaver 100% chargebacks can be useful in preventing loss. but payments being reversible (90+ days in many cases) means even a cash account involves credit risk exposure. reg E and all the other undo mechanisms are a big driver of underbanking

@colo_lee remain open minded. "consumer protection" measures are the number 1 driver of financial exclusion in the US
https://t.co/OYNXRBWLRB

@ncweaver banks will not open a checking account for people with bad credit. this is 100% due to the consumer protection measures applied to electronic payments. you can argue benefits outweigh the costs, but its not clear cut as you seem to suggest

@ncweaver you hold up reversibility of trad payment instruments as a benefit, but i dont think you understand the negative externalities this causes for users

this means any financial service involves an extension of credit and risk exposure, which increases financial exclusion
@ncweaver i view power consumption mostly as a non sequitur - proof of work is the past and present of crypto but not the future
@ncweaver confirmation bias. you dont seem open to info that conflicts with your existing worldview

probably going to regret this lol
